fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Continuous poset
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: I-1.16 of Continuous Lattices and Domains

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: A poset L is called continuous if it satisfies \forall x \in L. \ x = { \bigvee }^{ \uparrow } \downdownarrows x, that is, the family \downdownarrows x is directed and x is its least upper bound.
